plugins.name: Format AI
plugins.description:
Edit text as intended with Format.

Spellcheck, change text length and format text instantly with Format.


AI Features

  • Spellcheck: Say goodbye to typos and errors!
  • Text Length Control: Easily shorten or extend text to fit your layout requirements.
  • Text Auto-Adjust: Rewrite text so that it fits its textbox.
  • Text Format: Transform messy text into well-organized structure.
  • More features coming soon!


Basic Features

  • Merge multiple nodes into a single text node.
  • Split text node by line breaks.
  • Remove styling from multiple text nodes (hyperlinks, underscores and strikethroughs).


Instructions

  1. Select your text nodes.
  2. Open Quick Actions [Ctrl + /] or [Cmd + /].
  3. Type a command (e.g. Merge or Split).
  4. Press Enter/Return.


Reach Out

We are currently working on new features and would be happy to hear your suggestions. Please write us at inbox@debrief.design

plugins.name: Text Style Guide
plugins.description:
Generate text style guide from your local text styles

This plugin generates text style guide from your local text styles with all outputable properties in Figma Plugin.

And you can select that output properties at Figma Plugin UI.


Prerequirements

  1. Set your local styles


Usage

  1. Run this plugin
  2. If you have properties that you don't want to output, turn off the switch
  3. Click create button
  4. Text style guide frame is generated


Source code

https://github.com/yinm/figma-text-style-guide

plugins.name: Prototype to GIF/Video
plugins.description:
ğŸ”¥ Prototype to GIF/Video is the ultimate export tool for Figma

ğŸ¬ Export mobile apps, websites, landing pages, micro-interations

ğŸ¬ Export icons, loaders, logos

ğŸ¬ Export social media, videos, ads

ğŸ“‚ Export as GIF, Video, APNG

ğŸ‘† Render click and swipe guestures

â³ Adjust steps delay

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸš€ Support available 24/7


Itâ€™s quick and easy!


(beta) This is a public beta versionâ€”totally free for now!



ğŸ’¡ How to use it


1ï¸âƒ£ Make any Prototype in Figma

Ensure your prototype has at least one flow starting point.


2ï¸âƒ£ Open the plugin

Add an animation by clicking the appropriate button in the plugin.


3ï¸âƒ£ Setup User Flow Steps

Navigate through your prototype and add key steps.


4ï¸âƒ£ Click Export

Enable gesture rendering and adjust step delays if needed.



ğŸ“– Documentation


Quick Start Guide



ğŸ”¦ Features


Render Any Prototypes

Turn your prototypes into GIF, Video, or APNGâ€”supports all interaction types!


Smart Animations Support

Supports Smart Animate for smooth transitions between frames.


User Flows

Create and render full user flows in just a few clicks.


Super Easy to Use

Just add your steps and click Exportâ€”done in seconds!


Export to Multiple Formats

Save your animations as GIF, Video, and APNG.



ğŸ” Supported interactions


Layers

  1. Frames, rectangles, etc.
  2. Components, instances, but not component sets


Triggers

  1. On click
  2. After delay


Actions

  1. Navigate to
  2. Change to
  3. Back
  4. Scroll to
  5. Open overlay
  6. Swap overlay
  7. Close overlay


Animation

  1. Instant
  2. Dissolve
  3. Smart animate
  4. Move in
  5. Move out
  6. Push
  7. Slide in
  8. Slide out


Curves

  1. Linear
  2. Ease in
  3. Ease out
  4. Ease in and out
  5. Ease in back
  6. Ease out back
  7. Ease in and out back
  8. Custom bezier
  9. Gentle
  10. Custom Spring


We continuously add more supported features to make it even better.



ğŸ™‹â€â™‚ï¸ FAQ


What can I export with this plugin?

You can export interfaces, apps, websites, landing pages, promo videos, games, social media, micro-interactions, ads, Instagram stories, and YouTube shorts. The possibilities are endless!


Are Smart animations supported?

Yes! All Smart Animate transitions in your Figma prototypes are fully supported.


Why this plugin and not other tools?

No need for external apps or screen recording toolsâ€”everythingâ€™s built in!


Which export formats does this plugin support?

GIF â€“ Great for short, looping animations.

Video (MP4/WebM) â€“ High quality, small file size, ideal for social media.

APNG â€“ Animated PNG with full transparency.


What should I do if I have a problem?

You can always reach out via email or any of our social media channels. We strive to assist our users 24/7.



ğŸŒ Contact


You can always reach out to us at figmaprototypeplugin@gmail.com.

  2. https://prototypeplugin.com/

plugins.name: Crunch Image Optimization
plugins.description:
Optimize Groups, Layers, and Images before adding them to your sites.


We all know that keeping up with image optimization can fall off the radar really fast when you are cycling through design and approval. Leaving a lot on the developer to clean-up. Thankfully with Dev Mode you can now optimize your images right in Figma. No more need to export images, run to another program or the web, then upload to your site or development flow.


Optimize and review your designs right in Dev Mode by using JPEG or PNG image compression.


  1. Source: Choose between the source* image or the layer itself
  2. Scale: Adjust the scale you want the image to be optimized in
  3. Quality: Adjust quality to fine-tune your image
  4. Inspect: Pinch zoom on trackpads or ctrlKey + scroll to zoom image or drag your image around to see inspect the optimization.
  5. Optimized images will be displayed in the lower section of the Inspect Panel.


*Your fill needs to be the top-most fill in the Fill panel
plugins.tagline: Optimize your images for production directly in Dev Mode

plugins.name: Otto
plugins.description:
Hello! Meet Otto.


Otto is a very special caterpillar who lives inside Figma. Otto is rather shy and avoids attention (especially if you look like a hungry bird).


No one quite knows how Otto burrowed his way into Figma. For years, Otto has survived by munching on discarded letters and words deleted from text boxes in Figma files.


Unfortunately for Otto, Figma developers arenâ€™t big fans of bugs living in their software. So Otto does his very best to stay very hidden, living a quiet, calm life on the leaves of Figmaâ€™s gigantic node tree.


While Figma has countless users worldwide, few have actually seen even a glimpse of Otto in the wild â€¦ until today!


Thatâ€™s because Otto has a secret superpower: He can type fast.


I mean, really, really, really fast.


Otto doesnâ€™t like to brag about his special talent. But, if you ask him nicely to type something for you, heâ€™ll do it. (While shy, Otto is always willing to help others.)


This plugin lets you send typing requests to Otto. Just use a special character to wake him up, then type in a single character that matches up to the words or sentences you want him to type out. 


Otto types so quickly, you still wonâ€™t be able to see him â€” but youâ€™ll definitely see the trail of letters he leaves in his wake.


Thanks to Otto, you can be more efficient with text: Avoid typing the same word or sentence manually over and over. (This also gives Otto some much-needed exercise.)


This plugin even helps the environment! Otto types exclusively with 100% recycled text letters from deleted Figma files. (Fun fact: Otto has one of the worldâ€™s largest collections of the word â€œUntitledâ€ for some mysterious reason.)


If you have a question for Otto, please share it in the comments and Iâ€™ll see if I can get an answer from him. (Usually, I have to get Otto to type something such as â€˜Hey Otto! Whatâ€™s up?â€™ to get his attention.)


-----


Finally, one minor FYI: Otto is usually very comfortable moving around in Figma, whether itâ€™s a sticky note or a text box (heâ€™s even been known to chew on the text in a connector arrow from time to time).


However, Otto is very skittish around code blocks and canâ€™t wait to escape them (with so many coders hunting for bugs, I canâ€™t blame him one bit). So if you ask him to type something in the middle of a code block, heâ€™ll do it â€” but Otto will immediately dash to the end of the text. If youâ€™d call this a bug â€¦ well, that bugâ€™s name is Otto!

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Fluid Color Palettes
plugins.description:
Unleash the Power of Dynamic, Variable-Based Color Palettes in Figma


---

Generator your palettes: https://colors.fluid-design.io

Then paste the figma link into the plugin - And you're done!

---


When it comes to design, color is kingâ€”but managing your color palette shouldn't be a royal pain. Our Figma plugin simplifies the process like never before, allowing you to:


  1. Generate 1000+ Dynamic Variables with stepped-opacity: Instead of static color codes, receive variable-based palettes for total design flexibility. Switch between light and dark modes with zero manual adjustments. Then you can use your colors as variables like: color/primary/50, color/gray/100 or with opacity color/accent/500/95 or brand/foreground/70!
  2. One-Click Brand Palette Customization: Automatically generate a 'Brand Palette' designed for diverse use-cases like background, foreground, and moreâ€”all based on your chosen base colors.
  3. Seamless Design-to-Development Workflow: With one generated link, effortlessly integrate your palette into Figma and simultaneously generate color tokens for TailwindCSS and shadcn/ui. Ensure design consistency across platforms and speed up project timelines.


Close the Gap Between Design and Development

Our plugin doesn't just save designers timeâ€”it builds bridges between design and development teams. By generating unified color tokens, we ensure consistency and ease-of-use across various platforms. No more back-and-forths over color codes; just a single, harmonious workflow.


Affordable, One-Time Purchase

For a fixed one-time payment, gain lifetime access to all premium functionalities. Say goodbye to manual adjustments and accelerate your design workflowâ€”it's a game-changing investment that pays off instantly.


The Science Behind the Paletteâ€”Simplified

We employ advanced color science to make sure your palettes are not just stunning, but functional. And for those concerned with accessibility, rest assured: our colors meet WCAG 2.1 and APCA standards. But don't worry about the complexitiesâ€”our plugin does all the heavy lifting, so you can focus on what you do best: designing. And for those who're interested digging how these colors were picked, checkout the color science page.


Effortless Updates

Update your palette via our website at any time.


Ready to elevate your design workflow? Install our plugin today and experience the future of color management in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Fully variable-based colors. TailwindCSS-styled palettes. shadcn/ui color theme.

plugins.name: Variables Lint
plugins.description:
Variable Lint is Figma plugin to help in variable management and streamline design consistency.


Key Features:


Variable Stats: Gain valuable insights into variable usage with detailed statistics, including:


Track Assigned Variables: Track the number of variables currently in use across your design.


Identify Unused Variables: Identify variables that are defined but remain unutilized within your document.


Fix orphaned Variables: Detect variables that were previously assigned but are no longer linked to any elements.

Error Detection: Variable Lint intelligently detects and flags errors related to variable usage, such as:


Nodes missing Variables: Highlight instances where variables should be used but are hardcoded instead. Identify areas where variables could enhance design consistency but have not been applied.


With Variable Lint, designers can elevate their variable management practices, promoting design system consistency and accelerating the design iteration process.


Buy me coffee

accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.name: Text to Sticky Notes
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create sticky notes from any text-based elements on your FigJam board. Transform table content, selected text, shapes with text, or existing sticky notes into a neatly organized collection of sticky notes in just a few clicks. Perfect for brainstorming and organizing ideas.


Features:

  1. Create sticky notes in bulk.
  2. Seamlessly transform table content into sticky notes, extracting each cellâ€™s text and organizing it row by row.
  3. Generate sticky notes from selected text, shapes with text, or existing sticky notes on your FigJam board.
  4. Arrange sticky notes either horizontally or vertically, maintaining consistent spacing for a clean, organized look.
  5. View and modify text from selected objects directly in the pluginâ€™s input field.


How to Use

  1. Type your notes into the textfield, one note per line or select text, shapes, stickies, or tables to auto-fill the input field with their content..
  2. Select horizontal or vertical alignment for your sticky notes.
  3. Click "Create Notes" to instantly add them to your board.
plugins.tagline: Create sticky notes from inputted text, tables, or objects seamlessly in FigJam!

plugins.name: Design Feedback
plugins.description:
Improve your UI designs with instant detailed design feedback. This intuitive plugin provides personalized, actionable feedback within Figma, streamlining your design process and enhancing the quality of your work.


What Does it Do?

  • Comprehensive Analysis: From visual hierarchy to usability, this plugin examines your design across several critical aspects, ensuring no detail is overlooked.
  • Balanced Review: It highlights what's working well and what needs improvement, providing a balanced perspective that respects your design's unique style.
  • Actionable Recommendations: You receive specific, easy-to-understand suggestions for improvement.
  • Inclusive Design Focus: With a keen eye on accessibility and responsiveness, it ensures your designs are universally usable and aesthetically pleasing across all devices.


How It Works

  1. Upload & Analyze: Select your UI frame and let the plugin dissect its elements.
  2. Receive Expert Feedback: Instantly get structured, insightful feedback.
  3. Refine & Excel: Apply the suggestions, elevate your design quality, and learn best practices.


Ideal for Aspiring and Seasoned Designers

"Design Feedback" is a game-changer, especially for novice and intermediate designers seeking to hone their skills. It offers clear, instructive feedback that's easy to implement. Experts will also find value in its fresh insights and design affirmations.


Why Choose Design Feedback?

  • Saves Time: Get instant, expert-level critique without the wait.
  • Improves Design Quality: Elevate your designs with professional insights.
  • Educational: Learn best practices and common pitfalls in UI design.


Ready to transform your design process?

Embrace the power of expert feedback at your fingertips with "Design Feedback" â€“ your personal design consultant within Figma.

plugins.name: In-App Browser

How to use

  1. Paste the url that starts with https://
  2. Press Enter or click the Arrow icon
  3. Drag the bottom-right corner to resize
  4. Click the menu icon (triple dots) to customize settings


Tips

  1. Click any Text on the canvas that has a valid link to auto-fill the address bar

Light DSM plugin is an engineering design system application, it works simple: â€œTreat the design as a code engineering to buildâ€


We use scientific way to abstract design specifications, provide efficient design resource management capabilities, and finally output design deliverables to developers. There will be many innovative ideas about design engineering, please look forward to it :)


We provide the ability to import icon library resources into the plugin and apply to the figma canvas in the current version.


Usage:

1.  Login account, please note that only Baidu account login is supported now

2.  Click the button in the upper right corner(â€œimport resource libraryâ€)

3.  Search icon library resources from the Material Platform(material.baidu.com) (eg: Search for characters â€œlightâ€ in the search input)

4.  Click the "OK" button(bottom right corner) to import the icon resource


Icon resources are actually managed on the Material platform, DSM just call RESTful API, and the plugin supports synchronization of the icon library.


For more features, please look forward to subsequent versions.


Regards,

plugins.name: Toggle Spacers
plugins.description:
Toggle all your spacers with ease.


How to use this plugin:


  • Create a dedicated page for your spacer components and name it Spacers. Make sure this page only contains your spacer components and nothing else
  • Use your spacers freely, even in auto layouts (they will still occupy their space when hidden)
  • Toggle the visibility by using the Toggle Spacers â†’ All command (say via the context menu)


If you want your spacers page to be named differently you may use the the Toggle Spacers â†’ Select Page command to select a different page containing your spacers.


While similar plugins hide the actual instances of your spacer components, this plugin actually changes the components itself. This means that either all or no spacers will be visible at any given time.


The code for this plugin can be found at GitHub. Feel free to open an issue if you encounter any problems or have suggestions on how to improve the plugin.

plugins.name: Titleitos comment
plugins.description:
Titleitos: comment (Tiny)


Create titles and comments with a click of a button.

It's that simple.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select Titleitos from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a titleito!


If you select an Object / Frame and use the Titleitos plugin, the title will appear above on the y axis. If not, it will just float on your screen for fast use.


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Titleitos comment"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+m
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)

plugins.name: Slope
plugins.description:
Introducing "Slope" - The Figma Plugin for Generating Serial Strings with Ease!


Are you tired of manually creating serial strings for your design projects? Look no further! Slope is here to revolutionize the way you generate serial strings in Figma.


Whether you're designing software interfaces, creating unique product keys, or working on any project that requires sequential identification, Slope will be your go-to solution. With its seamless integration into Figma, you'll have the power to generate custom serial strings in just a few clicks.


Here's why Slope is a game-changer:


  • Customizable Patterns: Slope provides a wide range of customizable patterns, allowing you to create serial strings that match your specific requirements. From alphanumeric combinations to specific character placements, the possibilities are endless.


  • Sequential and Random Modes: Choose between sequential and random modes based on your project's needs. Sequential mode enables you to generate serial strings in a precise order, while random mode creates unique strings at the click of a button.


Save time, eliminate errors, and boost your productivity with Slope. It's time to streamline your workflow and focus on what matters most â€“ your design. Get the Slope Figma plugin today and unlock a whole new level of convenience and efficiency.

plugins.name: Smart Chroma
plugins.description:
Smart Chroma generates a color palette based on human vision.


If you create a color palette using a generic color space, the saturation and lightness of the appearance will appear to vary simply by changing the hue. This is because the saturation and lightness of the color space do not take human vision into account. This tool allows you to instantly and easily generate a color palette that takes human vision into account.


This tool is inspired by Color Space and uses the HCT color space internally. Source code available on GitHub.
plugins.tagline: A color palette generator based on human vision.

plugins.name: imgix Asset Manager
plugins.description:
With the Imgix Asset Manager plugin for Figma, you can easily build shared asset libraries across your team, search for and place existing image assets into your Figma designs, upload new high-resolution image assets, and export rasterized comps out of Figma that are immediately web-ready for sharing wherever they need to be shared.


How to Get Started

  1. Create a free imgix account if you don't have one today
  2. Set up a cloud storage source if you donâ€™t have one
  3. Try out the plugin
plugins.tagline: The end-to-end platform for visual media

plugins.name: Multiple images Placer / Replacer / Fill by Plantcss
plugins.description:
Drop your feedback how this plugin is increase productivity or else need improvement?



Demo Video:

Right click open new tab for better demo - https://youtu.be/pWsqRwKkkE8


Step !:

Import images from anywhere of the current project. Such as pages, frames, group and so on.


Step 2:

Select images or rectangles which we need to replace.


Step 3:

Just drag and drop image from import images to given replace box near to the old image box.


Step 4:

Finally click the "Replace images" button. More about please watch the demo video https://youtu.be/pWsqRwKkkE8 ( Right click open new tab for better demo )

plugins.description:

Compatible for Light and Dark mode.


Instructions

  • Select a frame
  • Select a permission
  • Choose a theme
  • Click on Create Screen!
  • Replace Google with you app name


How to reach out and support

Notes

  • Will be adding iOS as a selection
  • Missing Bluetooth permission, since its different from these

plugins.name: Style Station

COMPATIBLE WITH FIGMA DESKTOP APP OR CHROME BROWSER. DOESN'T WORK IN SAFARI


Check this article to get a detailed overview with examples.


Currently it supports only text and paint styles.


Send any feedback to mbazarov@gmail.com and
